intro: Plectranthus pobeguinii, commonly known as the Madagascar verbena, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the mint family. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or violet, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
